title: Abstraction
subject: Java
theory:
Abstraction is hiding the implementation details and showing only functionality to the user.

Example: Car Dashboard. You drive using steering/pedals (Interface), you don't know how combustion engine works inside (Implementation).

Achieved via:
1.  Abstract Classes (0-100% abstraction)
2.  Interfaces (100% abstraction)
syntax: // See Abstract Classes and Interface topics

examples.explanation: Bank defines rule: Everyone must implement getRateOfInterest.

common_mistakes.correction: `new Bank()` is Illegal. You cannot create objects of abstract classes.

interview_questions.question: When to use Abstract Class vs Interface?
interview_questions.answer: Use Abstract Class when you have shared state/code. Use Interface to define a contract/capabilities.

real_world_use_cases.description: JDBC (Java Database Connectivity) is a set of Interfaces. MySQL/Oracle provide Implementation (Drivers).
